items.text: I often feel anxious and worried about many things.
items.rationale: Anxiety is a core component of many clinical syndromes.

items.text: He frequently experiences mood swings that affect his daily life.
items.rationale: Mood instability is indicative of mood-related clinical syndromes.

items.text: She has persistent thoughts that she can't control.
items.rationale: Obsessive thoughts are characteristic of certain clinical syndromes.

items.text: I sometimes hear voices that others do not.
items.rationale: Auditory hallucinations are a symptom of psychotic disorders.

items.text: He often feels detached from reality.
items.rationale: Dissociation is a symptom of several clinical syndromes.

items.text: She has a hard time controlling her anger.
items.rationale: Difficulty with anger management can be part of impulse-control disorders.

items.text: I have little interest in activities I used to enjoy.
items.rationale: Anhedonia is a key symptom of depressive disorders.

items.text: He often feels like he is being watched or followed.
items.rationale: Paranoia is a symptom of certain psychotic disorders.

items.text: She experiences intense fear in social situations.
items.rationale: Social anxiety is a common clinical syndrome.

items.text: I have trouble sleeping because of racing thoughts.
items.rationale: Insomnia and racing thoughts are symptoms of anxiety and mood disorders.

items.text: He feels a strong need to perform certain rituals.
items.rationale: Compulsive rituals are characteristic of obsessive-compulsive disorder.

items.text: She often feels empty and without purpose.
items.rationale: Feelings of emptiness are associated with borderline personality disorder.

items.text: I sometimes feel like my emotions are too intense to handle.
items.rationale: Intense emotions can be part of mood disorders but also personality patterns.

items.text: He occasionally feels disconnected from his own body.
items.rationale: Depersonalization can occur in clinical syndromes but also in stress responses.

items.text: She often feels overwhelmed by her responsibilities.
items.rationale: Could map to anxiety disorders or stress-related modifying indices.

items.text: I tend to present myself in a very favorable light.
items.rationale: Self-presentation bias is a key aspect of modifying indices.

items.text: He often denies having any personal problems.
items.rationale: Denial is a common defense mechanism affecting modifying indices.

items.text: She frequently exaggerates her symptoms to get attention.
items.rationale: Symptom exaggeration is related to modifying indices.

items.text: I sometimes downplay my achievements to avoid standing out.
items.rationale: Underreporting achievements can be a form of impression management.

items.text: He tends to agree with others to avoid conflict.
items.rationale: Conflict avoidance can influence response styles in modifying indices.

items.text: She often changes her story to fit the situation.
items.rationale: Inconsistency in self-reporting is a modifying index factor.

items.text: I sometimes feel the need to justify my actions to others.
items.rationale: Justification of actions can be a form of self-presentation.

items.text: He often feels misunderstood by those around him.
items.rationale: Feeling misunderstood can affect how one reports symptoms.

items.text: She tends to minimize her problems when talking to others.
items.rationale: Minimization is a common response style in modifying indices.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I need to prove myself to others.
items.rationale: The need to prove oneself can influence self-reporting.

items.text: He often feels the need to defend his actions.
items.rationale: Defensiveness can be part of modifying indices but also personality patterns.

items.text: She occasionally feels like she has to exaggerate to be heard.
items.rationale: Exaggeration can be a modifying index but also a personality trait.

items.text: I sometimes feel like I need to hide my true feelings.
items.rationale: Could map to modifying indices or personality patterns related to emotional expression.

items.text: I prefer to be alone rather than with others.
items.rationale: Preference for solitude is a trait of certain personality patterns.

items.text: He often seeks out new and exciting experiences.
items.rationale: Sensation seeking is a characteristic of certain personality patterns.

items.text: She tends to be very detail-oriented and organized.
items.rationale: Attention to detail is a trait of certain personality patterns.

items.text: I often feel the need to be in control of situations.
items.rationale: A need for control is a common personality pattern.

items.text: He is usually very cautious and avoids taking risks.
items.rationale: Risk aversion is a trait of certain personality patterns.

items.text: She often puts others' needs before her own.
items.rationale: Selflessness is a characteristic of certain personality patterns.

items.text: I tend to be very competitive in most situations.
items.rationale: Competitiveness is a trait of certain personality patterns.

items.text: He often feels uncomfortable in unfamiliar situations.
items.rationale: Discomfort with novelty is a trait of certain personality patterns.

items.text: She tends to be very empathetic towards others.
items.rationale: Empathy is a characteristic of certain personality patterns.

items.text: I often find it hard to trust others.
items.rationale: Distrust is a trait of certain personality patterns.

items.text: He usually prefers to follow rather than lead.
items.rationale: Preference for following is a trait of certain personality patterns.

items.text: She sometimes feels like she needs to be perfect.
items.rationale: Perfectionism can be a personality pattern but also a modifying index.

items.text: I occasionally feel like I need to be the center of attention.
items.rationale: Attention-seeking can be a personality pattern but also a clinical syndrome.

items.text: He sometimes feels like he needs to be in control to feel secure.
items.rationale: Could map to personality patterns or modifying indices related to control.
